markdown:
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 29 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24 [Dmiri Yoltosha](/NPCs.aspx?ID=1536) **Source** [Pathfinder #145: Hellknight Hill](/Sources.aspx?ID=4) pg. 51 **Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +9, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +5, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +10, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +7, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +10 **Str** +3 **Dex** +4 **Con** +1 **Int** +0 **Wis** +1 **Cha** -1 **Items** [Composite Shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=75) (20 arrows), [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [key to chest](/Equipment.aspx?ID=13) (see Treasure), _+1 [leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4)_, _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [rapier](/Weapons.aspx?ID=36)_ --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +10 **Ref** +12 **Will** +9 **HP** 52 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _rapier_ +13 ([deadly 1d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 2d6+3 piercing **Melee** dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4+3 piercing **Ranged** composite shortbow +12 ([deadly 1d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)), **Damage** 1d6+1 piercing **Ranged** dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4+3 piercing **Flurry** Dmira's multiple attack penalty against her hunted prey is –3 (–2 with an [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) weapon) on her second attack and –6 (–4 with an agile weapon) on her third or subsequent attacks. **[Hunt Prey](/Actions.aspx?ID=10)** You designate a single creature as your prey and focus your attacks against that creature. You must be able to see or hear the prey, or you must be tracking the prey during exploration.
You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when you [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) your prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) checks when you [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) your prey. You also ignore the penalty for making ranged attacks within your second range increment against the prey you're hunting.
You can have only one creature designated as your prey at a time. If you use Hunt Prey against a creature when you already have a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. Your designation lasts until your next daily preparations. **Hunter's Aim** When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate. Make a ranged weapon Strike against your hunted prey. On this Strike, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and ignore your prey's [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) condition. **Twin Parry** **Requirements** You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand; **Effect** You use your two weapons to parry attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the [parry](/Traits.aspx?ID=190) trait. You lose this circumstance bonus if you no longer meet this feat's requirement. **Twin Takedown** **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand; **Effect** You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against your hunted prey, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same hunted prey, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.
name: Dmiri Yoltosha

text: Dmiri Yoltosha Recall Knowledge - Humanoid (Society): DC 29 Unspecific Lore : DC 27 Specific Lore : DC 24 Dmiri Yoltosha Source Pathfinder #145: Hellknight Hill pg. 51 Perception +14; darkvision Languages Common, Goblin Skills Acrobatics +10, Athletics +9, Deception +5, Nature +7, Stealth +10, Survival +7, Thievery +10 Str +3 Dex +4 Con +1 Int +0 Wis +1 Cha -1 Items Composite Shortbow (20 arrows), Dagger, key to chest (see Treasure), +1 leather armor , +1 striking rapier --- AC 22 Fort +10 Ref +12 Will +9 HP 52 --- Speed 25 feet Melee Single Action rapier +13 (deadly 1d8, Disarm, Finesse), Damage 2d6+3 piercing Melee Single Action dagger +12 (Agile, Finesse, versatile S), Damage 1d4+3 piercing Ranged Single Action composite shortbow +12 (deadly 1d10, range increment 60 feet, reload 0), Damage 1d6+1 piercing Ranged Single Action dagger +12 (Agile, thrown 10 feet, versatile S), Damage 1d4+3 piercing Flurry Dmira's multiple attack penalty against her hunted prey is –3 (–2 with an agile weapon) on her second attack and –6 (–4 with an agile weapon) on her third or subsequent attacks. Hunt Prey Single Action You designate a single creature as your prey and focus your attacks against that creature. You must be able to see or hear the prey, or you must be tracking the prey during exploration. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when you Seek your prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks when you Track your prey. You also ignore the penalty for making ranged attacks within your second range increment against the prey you're hunting. You can have only one creature designated as your prey at a time. If you use Hunt Prey against a creature when you already have a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. Your designation lasts until your next daily preparations. Hunter's Aim Two Actions When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate. Make a ranged weapon Strike against your hunted prey. On this Strike, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and ignore your prey's concealed condition. Twin Parry Single Action Requirements You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand; Effect You use your two weapons to parry attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the parry trait. You lose this circumstance bonus if you no longer meet this feat's requirement. Twin Takedown Single Action Frequency once per round; Requirements You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand; Effect You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against your hunted prey, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same hunted prey, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.
